title: Issue: Game won't load after champion select has loaded, recurring nightmare
body:
So, I've been having a continual issue, one that seems both a recurring nightmare for the LoL community (the last couple of threads on this issue have been from up to 7 months ago), and me- after champion select loads and finishes, and the game is supposed to load, I am greeted by a windows error sound, a black screen, and a loading popup that reads somewhere along the lines of 'Unable to connect to the server. Please retry at a different time' (I am paraphrasing there though). This is especially infuriating because when I hit the retry button, it simply continues with the same message, over and over. I cannot get out of this without closing the client, and reconnecting doesn't help much. I've tried almost everything in the "troubleshooting connections" page for fixes, and nothing has worked; I've lost 80lp and been placed in a low priority queue for it. What's even worse, however, is that is that it doesn't happen in patterns; it is ENTIRELY random. The game is still playable; this glitch only occurs about twice each month, but I'm becoming increasingly angry at it each time. I don't know why it's happening, nor what I can do to fix it, and I need help. I can't get out of this frustrating loop, of getting winstreaks broken by this, ranked games lost, and I'm becoming increasingly resentful towards the "do it yourself" nature of Riot's troubleshooting. I love this company, but your game is breaking me.

Thanks,

Asenappar

replies.body: You mentioned that this didn't seem to happen at any kind of specific frequency, so there might be a pretty good chance that this is coincidence but let's go ahead and take a few troubleshooting steps to check up on your [**network settings**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). You can use our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to follow some steps to setup port forwarding and how to flush you DNS, but definitely hit me back up if this starts happening more often.
